Context:
George Brown College is a publicly-funded college located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It offers various programs in business, technology, health sciences, liberal arts and community services. The college has a strong focus on providing students with practical experience through field education work terms, hands-on research projects, and industry partnerships.

Field Education opportunities include co-ops, applied project management, field-based consulting, field education courses, and applied research opportunities. Students can also get involved in volunteer programs, entrepreneurship resources, competitions, business clubs, trade shows, association events, case studies, and guest speakers.

The college has an international component with opportunities for international fieldwork, international field trips, academic pathways to educational institutions overseas, and global partnerships. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for the global marketplace.
